argument.name: setting_name
argument.description: The name of the setting, which becomes the record name in the dictionary table.

argument.name: dot_var_name
argument.description: The name of the dot variable containing the setting.

argument.name: dictionary
argument.description: Optional. Default = dictionary (.ALB file) for current database. The dictionary that will contain the setting.

page.description: Reads the contents of a setting in a dictionary into a 'dot_variable'. Setting created by a5_settings(). Record name is 'setting_name' and type is 'SAVU'.
page.discussion: The A5_LOAD_SETTINGS() method loads settings that are stored in a dictionary by A5_SAVE_SETTINGS() into a Dot_Variable. The type of the record in the dictionary table is "SAVU". Limitations: Desktop applications only.
page.example: dim mysettings as P dim mysettings.computer as C dim retrieve_settings as P mysettings.computer = "Compaq" a5_save_settings("Desktop computer", mysettings) a5_load_settings("Desktop computer", retrieve_settings) ? retrieve_settings = computer = "Compaq"
